conclusion: To determine when objects A and B are farthest apart, analyze their positions over time by comparing the areas under their v-t graphs.
The area under the curve for object A from time t = 0 to t = t2 can be calculated by integrating its velocity function over that interval.
The area under the curve for object B from t = 0 to t = t2 needs to be calculated.
The difference in displacement between the two objects at any time t is given by the difference in the areas under their respective v-t curves up to that time.
Find the time t at which the difference in displacement is maximized.
The time of maximum separation involves finding where the rate of change of the difference in displacement is zero, corresponding to equal velocities of A and B.
At t1, the velocity of object B is greater than that of object A, causing B to move ahead.
At t2, the velocity of object A becomes greater than that of object B.
The point where the velocities are equal is between t1 and t2, where the difference in their displacements is maximized.
The two objects are farthest apart at the time when their velocities are equal, between t1 and t2.
